required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Varying Portion Size and Palatability on Food Intake of Preschool Children
clinical_study.official_title: Lunch Feeding Study for Preschool Children

collaborator.agency: National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases (NIDDK)

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to determine the effect of varying both the portion size and the appeal (palatability and presentation) of foods served to preschool children at a meal on the outcomes of food and energy intake at the meal.

clinical_study.why_stopped: We observed reduced intake by the fifth week, so we are shortening the study and simplifying it by using a complete factorial design with four conditions.

primary_outcome.measure: Difference between interventions in meal energy intake

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference between interventions in food intake
secondary_outcome.description: Weight of food consumed at the meal (g)

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference between interventions in meal energy density
secondary_outcome.description: Energy density of the food consumed at the meal (kcal/g)

other_outcome.measure: Liking of food served at the meal
other_outcome.description: The Yummy-Yucky Cartoon Faces Scale (1=Yucky, 2=Just Okay, and 3=Yummy)

other_outcome.measure: Preference of plate and vegetables served at the meal
other_outcome.description: Preferred version of plate (1=non-divided plate, 2=divided plate), broccoli (1=standard appeal, 2=enhanced appeal), and corn (1=standard appeal, 2=enhanced appeal) of the two versions presented

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children who are enrolled in a scheduled classroom of the designated childcare centers
Exclusion Criteria:
- Children who are allergic to any of the foods served
- Children whose diets exclude any of the foods served
- Children who will not be present at the childcare center for all of the scheduled study days

facility.name: Laboratory for the Study of Human Ingestive Behavior, The Pennsylvania State University

responsible_party.investigator_title: Professor of Nutrition and Director of the Laboratory for the Study Human Ingestive Behavior
